Natural Earth II.tooltip:
Natural Earth II, darkened for contrast.
http://www.naturalearthdata.com/

Open Street Map.tooltip:
OpenStreetMap (OSM) is a collaborative project to create a free editable map of the world.
http://www.openstreetmap.org

Bing Maps Aerial.tooltip: Bing Maps standard road maps, provided by Cesium ion

Bing Maps Aerial with Labels.tooltip: Bing Maps aerial imagery with labels, provided by Cesium ion

Bing Maps Aerial with Roads.tooltip: Bing Maps standard road maps, provided by Cesium ion

ESRI World Imagery.tooltip:
World Imagery provides one meter or better satellite and aerial imagery.
http://www.esri.com

ESRI World Street Map.tooltip:
Street-level data for the world.
http://www.esri.com

ESRI National Geographic.tooltip:
National Geographic World Map service.
http://www.esri.com

Stamen Watercolor.tooltip:
Reminiscent of hand drawn maps.
http://maps.stamen.com

args.credit: Map tiles by Stamen Design, under CC BY 3.0. Data by OpenStreetMap, under CC BY SA.

Stamen Toner.tooltip:
A high contrast black and white map.
http://maps.stamen.com

args.credit: Map tiles by Stamen Design, under CC BY 3.0. Data by OpenStreetMap, under CC BY SA.

Sentinel-2.tooltip: Sentinel-2 cloudless by EOX IT Services GmbH (Contains modified Copernicus Sentinel data 2016 and 2017).

Blue Marble.tooltip: Blue Marble Next Generation July, 2004 imagery from NASA.

Earth at night.tooltip: The Earth at night, also known as The Black Marble, is a 500 meter resolution global composite imagery layer released by NASA.
